dom-mathmlelement.name: MathMLElement
dom-mathmlelement.summary: The MathMLElement interface represents any MathML element.
dom-mathmlelement.title: MathMLElement

the-math-script-level-property.name: math-depth
the-math-script-level-property.summary: The math-depth property describes a notion of depth for each element of a mathematical formula, with respect to the top-level container of that formula. Concretely, this is used to determine the computed value of the font-size property when its specified value is math.

firefox.notes: Implementation lacks support for font-size: math to be complete.

the-math-script-level-property.title: math-depth

the-math-shift.name: math-shift
the-math-shift.summary: The math-shift property indicates whether superscripts inside MathML formulas should be raised by a normal or compact shift.
the-math-shift.title: math-shift

the-math-style-property.name: math-style
the-math-style-property.summary: The math-style property indicates whether MathML equations should render with normal or compact height.
the-math-style-property.title: math-style

the-top-level-math-element.name: math
the-top-level-math-element.summary: The <math> MathML element is the top-level MathML element, used to write a single mathematical formula. It can be placed in HTML content where flow content is permitted.

chrome.notes: Removed in Chrome 25 because code was not yet production ready.

edge_blink.notes: Removed in Chrome 25 because code was not yet production ready.

the-top-level-math-element.title: <math>

error-message-merror.name: merror
error-message-merror.summary: The <merror> MathML element is used to display contents as error messages. The intent of this element is to provide a standard way for programs that generate MathML from other input to report syntax errors.
error-message-merror.title: <merror>

fractions-mfrac.name: mfrac
fractions-mfrac.summary: The <mfrac> MathML element is used to display fractions. It can also be used to mark up fraction-like objects such as binomial coefficients and Legendre symbols.
fractions-mfrac.title: <mfrac>

identifier-mi.name: mi
identifier-mi.summary: The <mi> MathML element indicates that the content should be rendered as an identifier such as function names, variables or symbolic constants. You can also have arbitrary text in it to mark up terms.
identifier-mi.title: <mi>

prescripts-and-tensor-indices-mmultiscri.name: mmultiscripts
prescripts-and-tensor-indices-mmultiscri.summary: The <mmultiscripts> MathML element is used to attach an arbitrary number of subscripts and superscripts to an expression at once, generalizing the <msubsup> element. Scripts can be either prescripts (placed before the expression) or postscripts (placed after it).
prescripts-and-tensor-indices-mmultiscri.title: <mmultiscripts>

number-mn.name: mn
number-mn.summary: The <mn> MathML element represents a numeric literal which is normally a sequence of digits with a possible separator (a dot or a comma). However, it is also allowed to have arbitrary text in it which is actually a numeric quantity, for example "eleven".
number-mn.title: <mn>

operator-fence-separator-or-accent-mo.name: mo
operator-fence-separator-or-accent-mo.summary: The <mo> MathML element represents an operator in a broad sense. Besides operators in strict mathematical meaning, this element also includes "operators" like parentheses, separators like comma and semicolon, or "absolute value" bars.
operator-fence-separator-or-accent-mo.title: <mo>

underscripts-and-overscripts-munder-move.name: mover
underscripts-and-overscripts-munder-move.summary: The <mover> MathML element is used to attach an accent or a limit over an expression. Use the following syntax: <mover> base overscript </mover>
underscripts-and-overscripts-munder-move.title: <mover>

underscripts-and-overscripts-munder-move.name: munder
underscripts-and-overscripts-munder-move.summary: The <munder> MathML element is used to attach an accent or a limit under an expression. It uses the following syntax: <munder> base underscript </munder>
underscripts-and-overscripts-munder-move.title: <munder>

underscripts-and-overscripts-munder-move.name: munderover
underscripts-and-overscripts-munder-move.summary: The <munderover> MathML element is used to attach accents or limits both under and over an expression.
underscripts-and-overscripts-munder-move.title: <munderover>

adjust-space-around-content-mpadded.name: mpadded
adjust-space-around-content-mpadded.summary: The <mpadded> MathML element is used to add extra padding and to set the general adjustment of position and size of enclosed contents.
adjust-space-around-content-mpadded.title: <mpadded>

making-sub-expressions-invisible-mphanto.name: mphantom
making-sub-expressions-invisible-mphanto.summary: The <mphantom> MathML element is rendered invisibly, but dimensions (such as height, width, and baseline position) are still kept.
making-sub-expressions-invisible-mphanto.title: <mphantom>

radicals-msqrt-mroot.name: mroot
radicals-msqrt-mroot.summary: The <mroot> MathML element is used to display roots with an explicit index. Two arguments are accepted, which leads to the syntax: <mroot> base index </mroot>.
radicals-msqrt-mroot.title: <mroot>

radicals-msqrt-mroot.name: msqrt
radicals-msqrt-mroot.summary: The <msqrt> MathML element is used to display square roots (no index is displayed). The square root accepts only one argument, which leads to the following syntax: <msqrt> base </msqrt>.
radicals-msqrt-mroot.title: <msqrt>

horizontally-group-sub-expressions-mrow.name: mrow
horizontally-group-sub-expressions-mrow.summary: The <mrow> MathML element is used to group sub-expressions, which usually contain one or more operators with their respective operands (such as <mi> and <mn>). This element renders as a horizontal row containing its arguments.
horizontally-group-sub-expressions-mrow.title: <mrow>

string-literal-ms.name: ms
string-literal-ms.summary: The <ms> MathML element represents a string literal meant to be interpreted by programming languages and computer algebra systems.
string-literal-ms.title: <ms>

space-mspace.name: mspace
space-mspace.summary: The <mspace> MathML element is used to display a blank space, whose size is set by its attributes.
space-mspace.title: <mspace>

style-change-mstyle.name: mstyle
style-change-mstyle.summary: The <mstyle> MathML element is used to change the style of its children.

chrome.notes: Only basic support with attributes dir, mathbackground, mathcolor and mathsize.

notes: In Firefox 29, accepted attributes have been restricted to those actually used in practice: id, class, style, href, mathcolor, mathbackground, scriptlevel, displaystyle, scriptsizemultiplier, scriptminsize, dir, mathsize, mathvariant, fontfamily, fontweight, fontstyle, fontsize, color, background.
In Firefox 103, attributes scriptsizemultiplier and scriptminsize have been removed.

edge_blink.notes: Only basic support with attributes dir, mathbackground, mathcolor and mathsize.

style-change-mstyle.title: <mstyle>

subscripts-and-superscripts-msub-msup-ms.name: msub
subscripts-and-superscripts-msub-msup-ms.summary: The <msub> MathML element is used to attach a subscript to an expression.
subscripts-and-superscripts-msub-msup-ms.title: <msub>

subscripts-and-superscripts-msub-msup-ms.name: msubsup
subscripts-and-superscripts-msub-msup-ms.summary: The <msubsup> MathML element is used to attach both a subscript and a superscript, together, to an expression.
subscripts-and-superscripts-msub-msup-ms.title: <msubsup>

subscripts-and-superscripts-msub-msup-ms.name: msup
subscripts-and-superscripts-msub-msup-ms.summary: The <msup> MathML element is used to attach a superscript to an expression.
subscripts-and-superscripts-msub-msup-ms.title: <msup>

table-or-matrix-mtable.name: mtable
table-or-matrix-mtable.summary: The <mtable> MathML element allows you to create tables or matrices. Its children are <mtr> elements (representing rows), each of them having <mtd> elements as its children (representing cells). These elements are similar to <table>, <tr> and <td> elements of HTML.
table-or-matrix-mtable.title: <mtable>

entry-in-table-or-matrix-mtd.name: mtd
entry-in-table-or-matrix-mtd.summary: The <mtd> MathML element represents a cell in a table or a matrix. It may only appear in a <mtr> element. This element is similar to the <td> element of HTML.
entry-in-table-or-matrix-mtd.title: <mtd>

text-mtext.name: mtext
text-mtext.summary: The <mtext> MathML element is used to render arbitrary text with no notational meaning, such as comments or annotations.
text-mtext.title: <mtext>

row-in-table-or-matrix-mtr.name: mtr
row-in-table-or-matrix-mtr.summary: The <mtr> MathML element represents a row in a table or a matrix. It may only appear in a <mtable> element and its children are <mtd> elements representing cells. This element is similar to the <tr> element of HTML.
row-in-table-or-matrix-mtr.title: <mtr>

semantics-and-presentation.name: semantics
semantics-and-presentation.summary: The <semantics> MathML element associates annotations with a MathML expression, for example its text source as a lightweight markup language or mathematical meaning expressed in a special XML dialect. Typically, its structure is:
semantics-and-presentation.title: <semantics>

dfn-dir.name: dir
dfn-dir.summary: The dir global attribute is an enumerated attribute that indicates the directionality of the MathML element.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 70, the attribute was only accepted on a few elements, as specified in MathML 3.

dfn-dir.title: dir

dfn-displaystyle.name: displaystyle
dfn-displaystyle.summary: The displaystyle global attribute is a boolean setting the math-style of a MathML element.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 83, the attribute was only accepted on a few elements, as specified in MathML 3, and was not implemented via math-style.

safari.notes: Since Safari 14.1, this attribute is implemented via math-style.

dfn-displaystyle.title: displaystyle

dfn-mathvariant.name: mathvariant
dfn-mathvariant.summary: The mathvariant global attribute attribute sets a logical class for textual elements, which is visually distinguished by using special Mathematical Alphanumeric Symbols. With the exception of mi elements with a single character, which are by convention italic, no special classes are used by default.

notes: Prior to Firefox 70, the attribute was only accepted on a few elements, as specified in MathML 3.
Implementation does not rely on the CSS approach described in MathML Core (via text-transform.
Safari only accepts the attribute on a few elements, as specified in MathML 3.
Implementation does not rely on the CSS approach described in MathML Core (via text-transform.

dfn-mathvariant.title: mathvariant

dfn-scriptlevel.name: scriptlevel
dfn-scriptlevel.summary: The scriptlevel global attribute sets the math-depth of a MathML element. It allows overriding rules from the user agent stylesheet that define automatic calculation of font-size within MathML formulas.

notes: Prior to Firefox 70, the attribute was only accepted on a few elements, as specified in MathML 3.
Implementation does not rely on the CSS approach described in MathML Core (via math-depth and font-size: math).

dfn-scriptlevel.title: scriptlevel
